intro: Euryops mirus, commonly known as the golden bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with small, narrow leaves. Its flowers are arranged in flat-topped clusters, and it blooms in the summer months. Euryops mirus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant color and drought tolerance.
